body_html:
It's a variable local to the default collating function, so you shouldn't depend on it. It's just an optimization and isn't required (torch.stack is sufficient). If you want to mimic that code, you can assume that it's True if you have worker subprocesses and False otherwise.

Also, note that we're using GitHub issues for bug reports only, and all questions should be posted on our forums.
body_text:
It's a variable local to the default collating function, so you shouldn't depend on it. It's just an optimization and isn't required (torch.stack is sufficient). If you want to mimic that code, you can assume that it's True if you have worker subprocesses and False otherwise.
Also, note that we're using GitHub issues for bug reports only, and all questions should be posted on our forums.
body:
It's a variable local to the default collating function, so you shouldn't depend on it. It's just an optimization and isn't required (`torch.stack` is sufficient). If you want to mimic that code, you can assume that it's True if you have worker subprocesses and False otherwise.

Also, note that we're using GitHub issues for bug reports only, and all questions should be posted on [our forums](discuss.pytorch.org).
